conclusion: Use the refractive index of the transparent body to calculate the time for light to travel from O to AB.
Refractive index of the transparent body is given as sqrt(2).
Speed of light in the transparent body is sqrt(2) times the speed of light in a vacuum.
Speed of light in a vacuum is c = 3 x 10^8 m/s.
Speed of light in the transparent body is 3 x 10^8 x sqrt(2) m/s.
Distance from point O to boundary AB is the same as the side of the trapezoid AB.
Length of AB is equal to the side of the trapezoid.
Use formula t = distance/speed to find time for light to travel from O to AB.
Distance from O to AB is sqrt(2).
Substitute values into formula: t = sqrt(2)/(3 x 10^8 x sqrt(2)).
Convert time to seconds: t = 10^-8 seconds.
